dialogue: Thank you for the supper, Mrs. Toth.
I thought we might have our own little party to celebrate all of your hard work. You've come so far, the both of you.
That's not what Laszlo tells me. He says he couldn't have done it without you.
Do you have a misses at home, Gordon?
William's mother, Augusta, passed away in `43- she got sick and died of a damned tooth infection of all things.
I am very sorry to hear that, and I am terribly sorry for your loss.

He's all right. He was too young then to remember much, and I was gone training two years in Arizona before they shipped us all off to Naples, Italy; 92nd Infantry Division. They wouldn't let me back home all that time, not once. Augusta's sister looked after him until I got back. Kept me alive though, knowing he was waiting for me.
Kept me good and alive, thank goodness.
Losing a mother- it's an unfathomable loss, you see. To lose one's birth mother is to lose the very foundation on which we stand.
The mind may not know its loss but the heart does.
